node.title: This funnel-web spider could bite through your fingernail. Its venom will also save lives
node.alt: A large funnel-web spider in a jar held balanced in someone's hand
node.description: A massive funnel-web spider with fangs so long they could bite through a human fingernail is donated to a lifesaving antivenom program at the Australian Reptile Park.
node.content: ["A member of the public has collected a funnel-web spider with fangs so long they could bite through your fingernail and donated it to a life saving antivenom program.\u00a0\u00a0", "The arachnid is so big that staff at\u00a0Australian Reptile Park\u00a0have\u00a0named it\u00a0Megaspider.\u00a0", "The park says the female\u00a0is roughly twice the size of a typical funnel-web spider, more comparable to a tarantula.", "The 8cm funnel-web spider's 2cm-long fangs will be milked for venom that can be turned into antivenom.", "The Australian Reptile Park, on the NSW central coast, is home to a\u00a0funnel-web spider venom-milking facility.\u00a0", "The antivenom produced there saves up to 300 lives a year, the park said.", "While venom from the spiders can have terrifying and potentially deadly impacts, some of the reactions caused by it can be live saving.", "For example, the chemicals in venom can be used to help blood coagulate or to thin, inhibit movement\u00a0or stimulate some other chemical processes in the body, which can be helpful in medical situations.", "Australian Reptile Park education officer Michael Tate had \"never seen a funnel-web spider this big\".", "\"She is unusually large and if we can get the public to hand in more spiders like her, it will only result in more lives being saved due to the huge amount of venom they can produce,\" he said.", "The park encourages citizen scientists to safely catch funnel-web spiders to donate to the antivenom program.", "Megaspider was donated in a clear plastic container with no marking to say where it came from.", "The park is now seeking the donor to find out where it came from, in the hope of finding similarly large spiders.", "Spiders can be donated to the park itself, as well as at a number of drop off points around Sydney, the Central Coast and Newcastle.", "AAP/ABC"]
